author: Robert Stickles
subject: Re: Availability of Lupin III in English (version 1.2) First Public Posting
body:
>From: Erik Schultz <erik@pond.com>
>Reply-To: lupin AT mcs DOT kent DOT edu
>To: lupin AT mcs DOT kent DOT edu
>Subject: Re: [lupin] Availability of Lupin III in English (version 1.2)  
>First Public Posting
>Date: Tue, 12 Jun 2001 00:00:05 -0400
>
>Robert Stickles wrote:
> >
> > SUB Neko Creations (defunct) as part of The Secret File
>
>   I am not sure Neko Creations is actually defunct - merely no longer
>public.  I haven't contacted them in a LONG time though.

Thanks for the input.  I haven't heard of any output from them in more than 
a year, although that doesn't preclude behind the scenes work for others in 
translation, timing, etc.  Also notable, but probably unreleated is that one 
of Neko's main distributers, ChiAnime, has also closed up shop.

Curiously, I've been able to find one distro that appears to list the 
remainder of the First TV Series as being available subtitled:

http://fansubnation.animebb.net/

Has anyone dealt with these guys?  My question to them as to wether it was 
the first Lupin series met with a response of 'the site has all the 
information you want', which really isn't the case at all.


Regards,
Rob S.
